subtitle: Breast is best if you are living with HIV
description: Breast is best if you are living with HIV
title: Breastmilk combats HIV
content:
Created by BabyCenter

If you are living with HIV, you may wonder if breastfeeding is a good thing. 

Remember, if you feed your baby only breastmilk and his antiretroviral (ARV) syrup every day, your baby is less likely to get HIV. Do not forget to take your baby to the health facility at 6 weeks so he can have a test for HIV. 

Your baby will need lots of food to grow. The best food for him is your breastmilk. Your milk is full of goodness that is perfect for your baby. It has all he needs to grow big and strong. It can also help to protect him from some diseases.

If you feed him breastmilk, ARV syrup and nothing else, not even water, for the first 6 months, you can help give him the best start in life. Even if you need to go back to work before this time, you can express your breastmilk and leave it for him. Your health worker can help you to learn how to do this.

Take advantage of your precious milk and let your baby have it as often as he wants. Let him feed until he has had enough. It will keep him healthy and happy.
